medium: Pen and brown ink and gray wash
title: View of a High Altar, perhaps in San Marco, Venice
text: Fascinated with Italian church interiors, Baldassare Cavallotti captured many of them in small ink-and-wash drawings. One here is inscribed with its location in the Basilica of San Marco, while the other appears to be a study of the tabernacle with carved columns that arches over the tomb of Saint Mark.
description: view inside St. Peter\'s; canopy over alter with figures worshipping; sketchy style
creditline: Gift of the Joseph F. McCrindle Collection
